Pemkot Medan Bikin Posko Cegah Bangkai Babi Dibuang ke Sungai
06 Nov 2019, 14:55 by Khairul Ikhwan Damanik
Medan - Ratusan bangkai babi di Sungai Bederah, Medan Marelan, Medan diduga sengaja dibuang. Penelusuran dilakukan terhadap pelaku pembuangan bangkai babi termasuk membuat posko pengawasan.
"Sekarang sudah dibuat posko, mengantisipasi ada pembuangan lagi. Kalau berdasarkan laporan, memang ada mobil yang membawa bangkai, dan membuangnya ke sungai," kata Kepala Dinas Lingkungan Hidup Pemkot Medan Armansyah Lubis di Medan, Rabu (6/11/2019).
Tim Dinas LH Medan sudah menerjunkan tim untuk memeriksa air sungai yang diduga tercemar akibat pembuangan bangkai babi. Proses pengambilan sampel sedang berlangsung.
"Nanti akan diperiksa di laboratorium. Hasilnya mungkin dalam seminggu atau dua minggu," kata Lubis.
Dia mengimbau masyarakat untuk membantu mengawasi bila ada pelaku pembuangan bangkai babi.
Bangkai-bangkai babi yang ditemukan di aliran Sungai Bederah, diduga mati karena terkena virus kolera babi. Kasus ini kematian akibat virus ini terjadi di beberapa daerah di Sumatera Utara (Sumut), termasuk Kabupaten Deli Serdang, wilayah tetangga Medan.
Di Medan sendiri tidak diizinkan adanya peternakan hewan berkaki
empat. Namun di wilayah Deli Serdang yang berbatasan dengan Deli Serdang seperti Pancur Batu dan Percut Sei Tuan, diketahui banyak rumah tangga yang memelihara ternak berkaki empat.

Medan City Government Makes Command Post Prevent Pigs Carcasses Disposed into the River
06 Nov 2019, 14:55 by Khairul Ikhwan Damanik
Medan - Hundreds of pig carcasses in Sungai Bederah, Medan Marelan, Medan are suspected of being deliberately disposed of. Tracing was carried out on the perpetrators of the disposal of pig carcasses including making surveillance posts.
"Now the post has been made, anticipating that there will be more disposal. If based on the report, there are indeed cars carrying carcasses, and throwing them into the river," said Head of the Medan City Government Environmental Agency Armansyah Lubis in Medan, Wednesday (11/06/2019).
The Medan LH Service Team has deployed a team to check the river water which is suspected to be polluted due to the disposal of pig carcasses. The sampling process is ongoing.
"Later it will be examined in a laboratory. The results may be in a week or two," Lubis said.
He appealed to the community to help supervise if there are perpetrators of pig carcass disposal.
Pig dead carcasses found in the Bederah River flow, allegedly died due to exposure to the pig cholera virus. This case of death from the virus occurred in several areas in North Sumatra (North Sumatra), including Deli Serdang Regency, neighboring Medan.
In Medan, no legged animal husbandry is permitted
four. However, in the Deli Serdang area bordering Deli Serdang such as Pancur Batu and Percut Sei Tuan, many households are known to keep four-legged cattle.
